etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin Pterosauria (plural), from Greek pteron ‘wing’ + sauros ‘lizard’

definitions: a fossil flying reptile of the Jurassic and Cretaceous periods, with membranous wings supported by a greatly lengthened fourth finger.

notes.text: Order Pterosauria, subdivision Archosauria: several families, including pterodactyls, pteranodons, etc.

shortDefinitions: fossil flying reptile of Jurassic and Cretaceous periods
